outcome.outcome_text: TR9: Investigate the treaty experiences of Indigenous people around the world.

indicator.p: Apply knowledge of Treaties in Canada to the experiences of Indigenous peoples in other countries.
Investigate the Canadian government’s response to the UN Declaration of the Rights for Indigenous Peoples.
Analyze the motives and actions of countries whose governments honour and support treaty relationships.
Analyze the motives and actions of countries whose governments oppress indigenous peoples.

outcome.outcome_text: SI9: Apply understanding of treaties and treaty making with world indigenous peoples.

indicator.p: Research and compare the treaties and treaty making processes within Saskatchewan and various countries (e.g. New Zealand, Ethiopia, Brazil, Japan).
Analyze the purpose of symbols used in treaty making from Canada to other countries.

outcome.outcome_text: HC9: Analyze how treaty making recognizes peoples’ rights and responsibilities.

indicator.p: Examine treaties involving Indigenous people from countries other than Canada (e.g., Treaty of Waitangi).
Investigate relationships between governments and Indigenous peoples and document the instances of peaceful resolution.
Compare the peaceful nature which Canada employed in the treaty making with the processes in other countries.
Relate Canada’s treaty making process to their peace keeping role in international affairs.

outcome.outcome_text: TPP9: Examine the effectiveness of treaty making in addressing the circumstances of Indigenous peoples.

indicator.p: Investigate treaties with Indigenous peoples in other countries.
Describe the circumstances that have prompted the negotiation of treaties in other countries.
Analyze the challenges Indigenous peoples face when negotiating treaties.
